meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inconsolable.
meanings.sent1: Her inconsolablenesses were evident after the loss of her beloved pet.
meanings.sent2: The inconsolablenesses of the child were heartbreaking to witness.
meanings.sent3: Despite his friends' efforts, his inconsolablenesses over the failed exam persisted.
meanings.sent4: The inconsolablenesses of the character in the movie mirrored my own feelings of loss.
meanings.sent5: The inconsolablenesses in her eyes spoke volumes about her inner turmoil.

meanings.definition: The inability to be comforted or consoled.
meanings.sent1: The inconsolablenesses of the grieving widow were palpable.
meanings.sent2: His inconsolablenesses made it challenging for his friends to offer support.
meanings.sent3: Despite the sunny weather, his inconsolablenesses clouded his mood.
meanings.sent4: The inconsolablenesses in her voice revealed the depth of her sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The inconsolablenesses in his demeanor showed that he needed time to heal.
